metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16515 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Matrix Synapse before 0.33.3.1 allows remote attackers to spoof events and possibly have unspecified other impacts by leveraging improper transaction and event signature validation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-16515` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

matrix-synapse - 0.99.2-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: msalvatore> This CVE covers a few problems. To exploit the first, you must be "the administrator of any server in a room". To exploit the second two requires a "malicious server".

criterions.comment: matrix-synapse package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.99.2-1').
